intro: Crucianella gilanica subsp. demavendensis, commonly known as the Demavend crucianella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils at higher elevations. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with compact growth and a dense foliage. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
